key_title: Key to the species of Marsdenia

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asclepiadaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asclepiadaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves oblong to broad-ovate, less than 5 times as long as wide; robust twiners of moist eastern forests
Leaves linear to narrow-lanceolate, 10–18 times as long as wide; slender twiner of the north-west Mallee
Leaves oblong-lanceolate, lower surface densely pubescent; flowers in compound cymes, yellowish; corolla-lobes glabrous inside; follicle fusiform
Leaves broad-oblong to broad-ovate, lower surface glabrous; flowers in simple umbels, whitish; corolla-lobes hairy inside near base; follicle ovoid
